biography.value:
“A spherical automaton clanks into view on three mechanical legs, its odd appendages whirring and clicking.”

These clockwork constructs act as guards and mechanized attendants to the @creature[ahu-nixta|ccodex].

Artificial Minions.

Built to serve its masters in a variety of ways, a mechanon can be customized to perform different tasks, and each mechanon is designed to be interchangeable with surrounding mechanons. They have enough sentience to follow simple commands and instructions.

Soul Powered.

A soul harvested from a living humanoid powers the glowing heart of a mechanon. The ahu-nixta initially developed the horrific process to transfer a soul into the construct, but the knowledge to do so has since spread. The gem heart continues to hunger for souls, drawing in new ones from the recently deceased to reactivate dormant mechanons.

Ahu-Nixta in Midgard

[–]

Mechanons are found in ahu-nixta communities, fortresses, and vessels across the planes of Midgard, serving as domestics. More dangerous are the lost or abandoned mechanons in wasteland areas of Midgard, where they scavenge for parts to repair themselves and to outfit their bodies with various tools and weapons to survive the harsh environs.

languages.custom: understands Deep Speech and Void Speech but has limited speech

description.value: The mechanon makes two Utility Arm attacks or one Slam attack and one Utility Arm attack.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+5]]{+5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 ([[/damage 2d6 + 3 type=bludgeoning]]) damage.

The mechanon has one of the following attack options:

  • @UUID[Actor.5HeDdIpDSstJeRTc.Item.HSs9bcrsKGlsz0hq]{Grabbing Claw.}
  • @UUID[Actor.5HeDdIpDSstJeRTc.Item.r45rsvOTbo21niL4]{Sonic Disruptor.}
  • @UUID[Actor.5HeDdIpDSstJeRTc.Item.bTG7acL0cT6WAKcj]{Telekinetic Projector.}

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+5]]{+5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 ([[/damage 2d4 + 3 type=piercing]]) damage. If the target is a creature, it is &Reference[condition=grappled] by the mechanon (escape DC 13). Until the grapple ends, the creature is &Reference[condition=restrained], and the mechanon can't use its Grabbing Claw on another target.

Ranged Spell Attack: [[/r 1d20+4]]{+4} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 9 ([[/damage 2d6 + 2 type=thunder]]) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save ability=constitution dc=12]] saving throw or be &Reference[condition=incapacitated] until the end of its next turn.

The mechanon fires a ray at a target it can see within 60 feet. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save ability=strength dc=13]] saving throw or the mechanon moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The mechanon can use the projector to manipulate simple tools or open doors and containers.
The mechanon swaps its Utility Arm with the Utility Arm of any other mechanon within 5 feet of it.
The mechanon touches an @creature[ahu-nixta|CCodex] or a Construct. The target regains 11 ([[/damage 2d8 + 2]]) hp.
The mechanon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.
A critical hit against the mechanon has a [[/r 1d100]]{20 percent} chance of striking the casing of the construct's soul chamber, stunning the mechanon until the end of its next turn.

A mechanon reduced to 0 hp stops functioning, becoming inert. For the next hour, if a Small or larger creature that isn't a Construct or Undead dies within 30 feet of a deactivated mechanon, a portion of the creature's soul is absorbed by the mechanon, and the construct reactivates, regaining all its hp plus additional hp equal to the dead creature's CR. If the mechanon remains inert for 1 hour, it is destroyed and can't be reactivated.
